update.description:
This is another portion of the Windows port. Client applications were forced to link against the physics and sensor libraries because the application used `libgazebo.so`.

This pull request creates a separate `libgazebo_client.so` that can be used by client applications. It's now up to the client application to link against physics, if they need it.

[Jenkins is clean](http://build.osrfoundation.org/view/gazebo/job/gazebo-any-devel-trusty-amd64-no-gpu/113/)
update.title: Break out libgazebo_client from libgazebo

content.raw:
Yeah, `gazebo/gazebo.hh` and `gazebo/gazebo_client.hh` should not be included in the same file. This translates to: you should never need to setup both a client and server in the same object. 

Now that I think about it, our ServerFixture may break this rule. Hmmm. I'll refactor.
content.html:
Yeah, gazebo/gazebo.hh and gazebo/gazebo_client.hh should not be included in the same file. This translates to: you should never need to setup both a client and server in the same object.

Now that I think about it, our ServerFixture may break this rule. Hmmm. I'll refactor.

This is another portion of the Windows port. Client applications were forced to link against the physics and sensor libraries because the application used `libgazebo.so`.

This pull request creates a separate `libgazebo_client.so` that can be used by client applications. It's now up to the client application to link against physics, if they need it.

[Jenkins is clean](http://build.osrfoundation.org/view/gazebo/job/gazebo-any-devel-trusty-amd64-no-gpu/113/)
update.title: Break out libgazebo_client from libgazebo

content.html:
The only thing that seems weird to me is that some functions are defined multiple times in the same namespace:

namespace gazebo
{
  void printVersion();
  void addPlugin(const std::string &_filename);
  bool shutdown();
}

These functions are defined in the gazebo namespace in both gazebo.cc/hh and gazebo_client.cc/hh. (The setupClient functions are duplicated as well, but they are deprecated, so I'm going to ignore them for now)

Is that ok? Or are we assuming that gazebo/gazebo.hh and gazebo/gazebo_client.hh should never be included from the same file?
